sql.desc: This query is used to show the number of databases.
This query is used to show the number of tables.
This query is used to select the database to which you want to work.
This query is used to create a database.

sql.element: CREATE TABLE CUSTOMER(id INT, name VARCHAR(255), address VARCHAR(255))
sql.desc: This query is used to create a table with columns (attributes). Note: We can't create a table without defining column names.
This query is used to show the schema of the table.
This query is used to insert a single entry (row) into the table.

sql.element: INSERT INTO CUSTOMER VALUES(2, 'Samuel', 'Thane West'), (3, 'Anderson', 'Thane East'), (4, 'Roy', 'Airoli')
sql.desc: This query is used to insert multiple entries (rows) into the table. For each insertion in a row, we have to start with an open parenthesis and close it, separated by commas.
This query is used to insert values into specific columns (attributes) of the table.
This query is used to show all the names from the given table.
This query is used to show all the rows from the given table.

html.desc: Defines a hyperlink.
Defines an abbreviation or acronym.
Defines contact information for the author/owner of a document.
Defines a clickable area within an image map.
Defines an independent, self-contained piece of content.
Defines content aside from the content it is placed in (like a sidebar).
Defines sound content.
Defines bold text.
Defines a base URL for relative URLs in a document.
Isolates a part of text that might be formatted in a different direction from other text outside it.
Overrides the current text direction.
Defines a section that is a block of content from another source.
Defines the document's body.
Defines a line break.
Defines a clickable button.
Defines a container for graphics.
Defines a table caption.
Defines the title of a work.
Defines a piece of computer code.
Defines a column in a table.
Defines a group of columns in a table.
Links a piece of content with a machine-readable translation.
Defines a list of pre-defined options for an `<input>` element.
Defines a description value in a description list.
Defines text that has been deleted from a document.
Defines additional details that the user can view or hide.
Defines a definition term.
Defines a dialog box or window.
Defines a division or section in a document.
Defines a description list.
Defines a term/name in a description list.
Defines emphasized text.
Defines a container for an external application or interactive content.
Groups related elements in a form.
Defines a caption for a `<figure>` element.
Defines self-contained content, like images, illustrations, diagrams, or code snippets.
Defines a footer for a document or section.
Defines an HTML form for user input.
Defines HTML headings (h1 to h6).
Defines HTML headings (h1 to h6).
Defines HTML headings (h1 to h6).
Defines HTML headings (h1 to h6).
Defines HTML headings (h1 to h6).
Defines HTML headings (h1 to h6).
Defines the head section of a document.
Defines a header for a document or section.
Defines a group of headings.
Defines a thematic break or horizontal rule.
Defines the root of an HTML document.
Defines italic text.
Defines an inline frame.
Defines an image.
Defines an input control.
Defines text that has been inserted into a document.
Defines keyboard input.
Defines a label for an `<input>` element.
Defines a caption for a `<fieldset>` element.
Defines a list item.
Defines the relationship between a document and an external resource (most used to link to stylesheets).
Defines the main content of a document.
Defines an image map.
Defines text that has been highlighted or marked.
Defines metadata about an HTML document.
Defines a scalar measurement within a known range (like a disk usage gauge).
Defines navigation links.
Defines an alternative content for users that have disabled scripts in their browser.
Defines an embedded object.
Defines an ordered list.
Defines a group of related options in a dropdown list.
Defines an option in a dropdown list.
Defines the result of a calculation.
Defines a paragraph.
Defines a parameter for an object.
Defines a container for multiple `<source>` elements for responsive images.
Defines preformatted text.
Defines the progress of a task.
Defines a short quotation.
Defines what to show in browsers that do not support ruby annotations.
Defines an explanation or pronunciation of characters (used in East Asian typography).
Defines a ruby annotation (used in East Asian typography).

css.desc: Sets the default font and background color for the entire page.
Defines styles for all header elements, including font size, weight, and margin.
Controls the appearance of paragraphs, including line height, margin, and font size.
Styles anchor links, including color, text decoration, and hover effects.
A generic container for grouping and styling blocks of content.
Specifies how images should be displayed, including width, height, and borders.
Styles unordered and ordered lists, including list-style type and padding.
Styles tables, including borders, spacing, and alignment of table cells.
Styles forms, including input fields, labels, and button appearances.
Defines the appearance of input fields within forms, including type-specific styles.

javascript.desc: Declares a variable that can be re-assigned. It's function-scoped and is used to store data.
Declares a block-scoped variable that can be re-assigned. It's preferred over 'var' for better scope management.
Declares a block-scoped variable that cannot be re-assigned after its initial assignment. It is used for constants.
Defines a function. Functions can be declared in various ways, including function declarations and function expressions.
A control flow statement used to execute code based on a condition. 'else' provides an alternative block if the condition is false.
A control flow statement used for iteration, executing a block of code a specific number of times.
A control flow statement that executes a block of code as long as a specified condition is true.
A statement used for handling exceptions. 'try' contains code that might throw an error, while 'catch' handles the error.
Syntax for working with asynchronous code. 'async' declares a function as asynchronous, and 'await' pauses execution until a promise is resolved.
A function used to make network requests and handle responses. It's a modern alternative to XMLHttpRequest.
Defines a class for creating objects with shared properties and methods. Introduced in ES6, it’s syntactic sugar over JavaScript's existing prototype-based inheritance.
A shorter syntax for writing functions. They do not have their own 'this', 'arguments', or 'super' context.
